Item.Review: I like the size-it will fit in my pocket. Like the 2 rings for adjusting in manual; the ring around the function key does move a little too easily as suggested in the reviews. I've read the manual twice so far, but when it gets to taking pics using the different functions, I'm still getting lost. I've been playing with all the knobs and battery seems to wear down quickly. I was looking for a small camera to take on vacation and this fits the bill. Also wanted something a little more fancy that would allow me more creativity. Bought a book on Understanding Exposure and it really helped me to better understand the basic camera functions (f stops; shutter speed; ISO). Only now I'm wishing I bought a DSLR with even greater range. It is a real trade-off between size and options. Maybe I ... 'll have to buy the DLSR when I get this one mastered.... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Amazing picture quality and manual features for a point-and-shot size camera. Perfect for SLR enthusiasts that would like to have an alternate small camera to carry in your pocket, and at the same time have all the manual adjustments of an SLR. Of course is not the same as an SLR, but it has all major features like RAW files, aperture and speed priority, manual control. The controls are easy and well located. The wheel around the lenses are perfect as a second adjustment control. Flash level can be adjusted, avoiding saturated light when shooting near the person. Also very nice for people that want to start learning photography and don't wanna invest in an full SLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Huge camera in a tiny case, shocks the pros
Item.Review:
Pros: Image quality, lens quality, wide angle, size, adjustment options
Cons: Wrist strap sticks to velcro, frays easily. That's it.
Used it on a bicycling tour of Vietnam and Cambodia a week after purchasing it. Two of my photos were purchased and published in print and on the web by a global adventure travel co. Tiny camera contains Canon's full sized image capture chip. It records very sharp detail delivered through the camera's outstanding wide angle lens. Compact size allowed me to shoot pix with one hand while biking through crazy city traffic, on dirt roads dodging pot holes and animals, and some sneaky pix of people in markets.. Bright display. Image adjustment options to match a pro level SLR make it a super flexible, super quality little bomb of a camera. My first o ... ne was stolen. Had to buy the exact same model. Nothing else compares. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Great image quality; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Limited Zoom
Well, I just got this camera, and it is a lot different from the previous Canon PowerShot ones I've owned. More complicated settings, and I am not sure I like the "automatic" macro feature. So far the photos are very nice and crisp, clear, true colors. I really might give it 5 stars after I get to know it better, but so far the controls are not intuitive, so I ding'ed it one star. Also, for the price, I think there should be more than 3.8x zoom, after all, there are other P&S cameras with up to 10x!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Its sleek its got everything you want or need and its easy to use
Cons: Its expensive for what it has to offer. and Its has no touch screen.
Its good for people wanting a high end point and shoot camera. It does have a bit to lack for its price. one no touch screen. and It should have a memory card at least 4GB. and at least 12 mp would be nice. for four hundred its not the best value but is very sleek. and has features you would expect. and is a good camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, not all of kit so good
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Great Zoom; Good Image Stabilization; Video Audio great
Cons: Camera case poor quality; Smooth body is slippery
Used this camera at a wedding a few days after receiving it. Even though I did not have a lot of "practice" time before I used it, the photos and videos came out great. It really took great pics in the low light at the reception. If you purchase this camera with a kit that has the "DigPro" case included, I suggest that you not use this case. After only a few times of removing the camera from the case and replacing it, the zipper broke. I've since bought the Canon case made for the camera. It is more expensive, but the camera fits perfectly and it uses a magnetic flap which allows easier "in and out" and keeps it secure when closed. I would ... still recommend that you buy the kit because even without the case it is a good value. The only other problem I have is holding on to the camera. The body is very smooth and therefore the camera is slippery. The hand strap saved me from dropping it a few times already. I emailed Canon support about this and suggested that they consider producing a body that is rough/grainy on future models. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Easily control manual settings with a control ring up front on the lens and another on the back. Can change Fstop, Shutter Speed, and ISO on the fly, and get great photos with a small, compact camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Decided to get an additional P&S to carry in lieu of a large DSLR. Read all the reviews and found this camera to fit my needs. I would recommend this camera for those who are comfortable with manipulating settings to get the most out of it however it does have a nice A automatic mode where a beginner would be able to grow into all its options to control settings. The only cons I have found so far is that the focus mode has a difficult time in very dim/dark settings. The small slick body does not build confidence where I feel as if the camera can slip out of my hands. The control ring seem to be made of plastic, could improve by matching it's material of metal on the ring. At the end of the day, the pros out weigh the cons... This truly is a camera I can carry with me in a nice ... small package and know I would be able to capture nice photos. I am historically a Nikon advocate but cannot say enough that Canon hit a home run with the S90. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I just bought this camera two weeks ago and i absolutely love it. I knew a bit about f-stops and ISO controls before, but its always been a bit complicated. However, this camera has a fantastic interface that explains all the settings on the screen. Also, the the two spinning dials are totally intuitive, so you can quickly play with settings and experiment easily with different effects. I haven't had to even look at the manual and I've been taking some fantastic shots. The only downside is a slightly short battery life and the zoom is not hugely powerful, but to be honest I haven't really been bothered by either.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great images - when they are in focus!
Item.Review: We sent this camera back because it has a hard time in auto focus and a point and shoot camera should be great at auto focus. It has very nice color balance and when it could get the shot the images were very nice indeed - but it missed the shot too many times. The focus troubles occured in low light. We use the camera for family snap-shots.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The s90 received rave reviews from many of the photo blogs and I think the praise is well deserved. For it's small size, the s90 has the best photo quality and low light performance that I've seen. The colors are vivid and saturated (far more more than in real life) and this camera tends to flatter anything it captures. No, the s90 is not a substitute for an SLR, but at it's best it can rival the quality of an entry level SLR at half of the price and a quarter of the size. I'll be happy to have an s90 in my pocket for my upcoming trip to Europe.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Tiny camera with SLR quality photos
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color
Cons: Short Battery Life
Bought the camera for European vacation. Found myself using the camera more than my SLRs because of size, photo quality using RAW, and low light performance.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Short Lag Time
This camera is GREAT!!! I highly recommend it. Super for indoor shooting in low light. As close to a DSLR as you can get. Super sharp in a small package.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Bought this camera for our honeymoon. Both my wife and use pro level Canon SLRs but didn't want to have to take them and worry about them during the trip. Being the first trip that I didn't travel without my 1d I was pretty skeptical of this camera. It was great! We used it on manual mode the entire trip shooting in RAW and the photos turned out really nicely. The manual controls are by far the easiest I have seen on a point and shoot. After a few minutes of playing with the camera it felt pretty natural. It's not a replacement for an SLR by any means but it takes some really nice photos. My only real complaint about this camera is that it does not shoot high definition video. the standard definition that it does record looks does the job. RAW capability and size was the big selling p ... oint for me. Great product! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera is for serious amateur and professional photographers as a backup camera and to have with them when a larger SLR camera is not practical to carry. It is also suited for the beginner who wishes to grow their skills before making a really major investment. You can use it as a point and shoot on full Auto or as an artistic tool on full manual. With a 4Gb memory card, it will also take up to 45 minutes of regular video. If you are the type of person who only wants a fully automatic point and shoot, Canon does make less expensive cameras. Although often criticised for the ease with which one of the controls on the back can be accidentally turned, because of how this control is used, I have not found that to be a problem. The camera seems well made and sturdy. The camera has enoug ... h flexibility and controls to satisfy even the strictest techy. The only problem I have had is getting use to the dial around the lens and the hand placement when trying to use this dial and keeping my finger on the shutter button. I love the programmable function buttons and dials. I traded up from a Canon SD800IS and I am glad that I did. My main camera is a Nikon D-300. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Usually the word compromise is considered a negative. But when one wants the best of two diametrically opposite worlds, coming up with a solution can be tricky. Well, Canon has done it. I have a great DSLR (Canon 7D) but it's bulky and just can't be taken everywhere. I have a great pocket camera, an old Canon SD800IS but it doesn't give me the controls that I want. So I searched for the best quality, most adjustable camera that can fit easily in one's pocket and the S90 was it. The images are first rate. I can shoot RAW+JPG. I can control a host of settings quickly and easily. A Perfect Compromise! And that's a good thing.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, still drawbacks of compacts
Item.Review:
Pros: Decent low light, great controls for a compact
Cons: It is a compact, no HD video
This is a great compact camera. I usually use a digital SLR, so for me there are a bunch of compromises with a compact, but it fits in a pocket, so that is a good tradeoff.
It has pretty good low light capabilities, and the picture quality is great in good light.
The controls are great, with the back control wheel and the lens ring control.
It is still a lot slower to take pictures with than a dSLR, but that is a general problem with compacts.
It would be nice if it had HD video, but that is a minor thing for me.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Great Zoom; Good Image Stabilization; Good in Low Light
Cons: Camera more difficult
This one was bought for my wife, who is a bit of a Luddite but likes the simplicity of use on full auto. She doesn't shoot much, so film stays in her camera forever. But she doesn't care for computers, either. But the image quality, ease of use, and accuracy of autofocus have won her over - even if I still have to handle the uploading and print orders. It's the first Canon in the house (I'm a Nikon bigot), and the price is right in the same range as some pretty capable P-series Nikons. But for a compact, easy to use yet flexible enough for anyone desiring more control, this may well be the best one available right now. Shutter lag is much better than on my waterproof Pent ... ax, a bit more than on any of my Nikons - but it's just something that requires a bit of getting accustomed, rather than a problem. Overall, a great camera for what it's intended to be. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD
Cons: Control knobs loose; Slick body hard to hold; Drops backgrounds outside
i just hated how slick and hard to hold this little camera was. it was easy to drop. i also hated how the control knobs kept moving so easily and they would mess up the settings i wanted. also, this camera would drop exposure on any outdoors background. it was awesome for indoor shots without flash.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes excellent photo's for its's size
Cons: A little hard to hold, wish it had been cheaper!
I really like the s90. I have only used it a little more than a month but it does a lot of things for a point and shoot camera this tiny. The tiny part is why I didn't give it five stars for ease of use. I purchased Richard Franic's accessory grip and it helps tremendously but it is still tough. I am going to cut some small strips of adhesive backed sand paper and apply them in strategic places. I do have some trouble with my ability to grip small items and I always have so it probably wouldn't apply to everyone. Several other complaints that I read about this camera before I purchased it were that the flash was in a bad position and the adjustment wheel was easily moved acc ... identally. I haven't found this to be the case, yes the flash is in a position that your finger normally rests but where else could they put it? I haven't had any problem at all with the wheel even before I added the accessory grip. It has been a non- issue. I haven't even began to touch all of the possibilities of the adjustments available. It takes wonderful pictures when you get it right and there is always the programmed presets if you need them. I need to spend some more time to learn everything that it can do but that is the great part, learning it all! It is an expensive camera in this range but it has so much to offer for the money you are spending. It is as close to a DSLR as you can slip in your pocket. Best Buy dropped the price $30.00 the day I went shopping for it, if that wasn't a sign I don't know what one would be. I feel like I have bought the last point and shoot camera I will ever need. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: If you are looking for a camera that fits into your jeans pocket this is a good choice. It takes good pictures during the day (ISO 100) or if it's mounted on a tripod. However be ware that if you are not using a tripod and go above ISO 500 you will have a lot of noise in your pictures. Also it shows some noise in high contrast scenes as well even at ISO 320. Be prepared to tweak it to get some decent color. Given the size of the camera I am ok with the IQ. This is a good compact camera if you understand its limitations. I would rather have some noise in my pictures than not have an image that I liked just because I did not feel like carrying my DSLR that day. Trek-Tech has a little grip/clamp called VersaMount I highly recommend it with this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The best point and shoot camera
Item.Review: I use the Canon s90 for everything. I don't care about shooting HD videos or I would buy a HD video camera. Great for landscapes and people pics. Fantastic macro ability. I leave my SLR at home and carry the s90 everywhere. It's so light I can't even tell it's in my pocket. With the beautiful 3 inch screen who needs a viewfinder. I haven't found anything I don't like about it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera is by far my favorite point and shoot to date. The ability to control aperture and exposure compensation with two click wheels is amazing and extremely fast. I have rather large hands and always struggled with tiny little buttons on other pocket point and shoots - with a large programmable wheel on the front (mine is set to aperture) and a smaller wheel for your thumb on the back (exposure comp) it's very easy to get it right in camera. I'm really impressed with the overall image quality and the reviews on the sensor used for this camera give it very high honors. With so many compact cameras cramming as many pixels as they can on a sensor - its refreshing to see more models utilizing quality over quantity. Some people gripe about the lack of HD on the video -- meh, it wo ... uld have been nice but the quality is good enough for my needs. I'm just happy that I don't have to try and cram my LX3 in a pocket anymore! This camera is just the right size for a pocket yet still big enough to not feel like a kids toy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is a very cool little camera. Cool because it has a bright (f/2.0) wide (20mm eqiv) lens. Cool because it has lots of manual controls and a unique control ring around the lens barrel where aperture rings used to be. The lens is very sharp, and image quality is very good. The ability to shoot RAW with manual controls in a very pocketable body is paramount to me. This is a camera to always have with you, one which won't disappoint in poor lighting conditions and offers lots of flexibility for the advanced shooter. Not really a beginners camera, a bit pricey for most, but the overall mix of control, IQ and size make it worth the money for me. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Point and Shoot Camera for taking pics
Item.Review:
Pros: picture quality is better than most point and shoot cameras
Cons: there's a lot to remember
THis camera takes great shots with very low noise. I'm impressed by the quality of the shots even with the ISO set as high as 400. With a lens opening of f2 and the cleanliness of the shots this camera takes low light pictures better than any other small camera that I have owned. If you are interested in a pocket camera that is good in low light this one is a very good choice. It is definitely targeted for the photo buff because there is no HD video and that's fine with me because I bought this camera for photos, not video. The control rings are a fantastic aid to getting better shots. They supply more control than any other small camera. It also takes pictures in raw format. I h ... ighly recomend this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great 2nd camera when a DSLR is too big
Item.Review: My main camera is the 5DM2 but sometimes it is too big to take along. I bought the s90 for those times and I really like the following features three feature. One, it is very small and easily fits in a jacket pocket or front pants pocket (this was the most important criterion). Two, the S90 gives you the ability to control aperture, shutter and ISO easily, unlike many small point and shoot cameras that only work in pre-set program modes. I shoot almost exclusively in Aperture Preferred so I set the front ring around the lens to aperture and the shortcut button to ISO. This way, I can quickly pick the aperture and ISO combination that gives me the minimum shutter I need. I have tried shots with the ISO up to 1600 and the noise level is quite good although one would probably not want t ... o try a 11x17 print from this camera. Third, this camera will shoot Canon Raw format in addition to JPegs. One slight annoyance is the problem I had getting it set to take Raw + Jpeg. While the menu system has a spot to select Raw + Jpeg on, the camera will not actually record the raw file. To make it do so, you have to go into the preferences menu and select Raw first. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was reluctant to buy the S90 because I love my Canon SD900! And I still do! I didn't think there was enough reason for me to upgrade. Even the midrange P&S cameras had better zoom and HD video (come on Canon)! But I wanted a waterproof case for my trip and figured I might as well upgrade since the SD900 was over three years old. What I missed most are the ergonomic features. The SD900 was perfect in my hands. I could operate it single handedly. The S90 is not so smooth and some of the buttons are positioned in annoying places, including the on/off button. The popup flash is constantly in my way to where I have to disable it and only enable it when I want a flash. And the control dial changes my exposures without my knowledge. The best feature I like about this camera is t ... he low light option. It certainly delivers great images for a P&S... WOW! I just wished it saved the low light images as LARGE and not MEDIUM, resulting in under 1MB pictures! Despite all this and the cost, it's still a great camera and I will keep it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: excellent pictures for pocket camera
The S90 is probably the best camera you can buy that will fit in your pocket. It's sensor (1/1.7') is roughly twice the size of most compact cameras. The pictures are clear and beautiful, even in low light. I was tired of blurry or otherwise poor pictures from other cameras, so I bought the S90 and am very pleased. The camera is easy to use, and the feature set is great.
The main complaint that I've read about is ergonomics. I'm a 6' male and have had no problems. The zoom is 3.7x, so this is not the camera for an activity like bird watching.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: A point-and-shoot for those who want to tweak.
Item.Review:
Pros: Myriad of picture and operational settings.
Cons: Clunky power zoom, limited zoom range.
The PowerShot S90 is a great camera. With 100's of different point-and-shoot cameras available, I was looking for one that provided above average parameter settings to allow for more creative shots without having to go to a standard 35MM DSLR body size. This camera definitely delivers in this respect.
I've only had the camera a couple of weeks and have not had a lot of time to work with it yet, but I'm certainly pleased with it so far. It starts up fast and the "auto" mode works fine for most shooting situations.
Because there are so many things that can be adjusted with the settings, the use of a "lens ring" and "dial around cursor buttons" for changing settings is ve ... ry helpful. Depending on the shooting mode you are in, a dial around the lens will make one adjustment, then the other dial allows secondary adjustment preventing the need for digging through layers of menus. It will take a while to master all the different mode configurations, but it's a novel approach.
The only thing I would complain about is the power optical zoom is not as smooth as you would expect on a camera at this price level. The zoom adjustment is a tiny little lever too that's a bit hard to operate. The overall build quality and feel of the device is excellent.
I would recommend this camera for people who DO want to dig into making adjustments to the shooting parameters. If you just want a camera to snap decent shots, then it would be unnecessary overkill and you can probably find something good at half the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: They say the best camera is the one you have with you. This camera is small enough to take anywhere, and takes superb pictures. The only drawback is the lack of a hotshoe, but it's a small price to pay for portability. It takes pictures just as good as the g11, maybe even better because of the faster lens. I love the ring control as well.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: It's easy to use,the functions great, good pictures especailly for the night time. The color of the picture is awesome.
Cons: no HD vedio, and it's not that great if you use to picture the moving views.
This is a good camera that you can use in most of your daily life, especially excellent for the night use. The function is good, and the batery is also lasted long. Although it doesn't have the HD vedio function, it's vedio function is still satisfy. The only thing I don't like is it's not good to capture the moving moment and the price is a litte bit expensive. After all, a good camera and worth buying.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Canon S90 offers a great deal of versatility and manual controls when compared to most cameras of this size. In fact, the S90 sports many of the same features we saw on the G11 but it is a camera that you will carry with you because of its size. The S90 also performs very well when using its higher ISO capabilities. I was able to capture some high-quality photos without a problem; the photo's look fantastic in low light. That said, the S90 does capture good video, with very little noise and smooth playback but not in HD. The microphone produces decent audio and hand no problems picking up an array of sounds. The S90's battery life was good but I would recommend picking up a spare battery for travel and uninterrupted picture taking. Simply this is the best compact I have ever seen , you wi ... ll love it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Small / Compact; Short Lag Time; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light
Cons: Limited Zoom
Just what I needed when I travel. The image quality is outstanding, and the camera's got great point-and-shoot capabilities while also maintaining the functions to manually adjust. Battery lasts forever and the whole thing is the perfect size to carry all over the world.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I've had a Canon SD630 for a few years now, but I wanted a carry-around camera that had the ability to shoot at least in aperture- and shutter-priority modes. I also wanted to try my hand at shooting RAW. I looked at the G11, but it was a little on the large side. The S90 was the perfect choice for me! I get great low-light shots, picture quality is excellent, and I have all the manual control I need. Furthermore, unlike my old SLR, it's small and light enough that it actually leaves the house with me! I no longer miss great shots because I don't have my camera with me. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this camera as a back up to my DSL for travel and everyday use. Small and easy to carry in a pocket. Great quality of photos. Have not tried video and am getting used to a small point and shoot. Not used to such a small camera. Easy to use and has a load of options to choose from.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: One of the best point and shoot cameras out in the market. The ease of using the camera is fantastic. The ring feature isn't too necessary, but quite unique. Picture quality isn't grainy or blurry. It turns out a lot better than other canon p&s like sd1200 or sd780is. If you need a camera under low light conditions, this is the camera for you.The screen is huge for previewing. Overall, best P&S camera I've used. Although the price is expensive, it is well worth the price. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The case feels very substantial, and it never leaked during a week long rafting trip. I used it under water (maybe 2 feet) and in very wet and rough conditions, and it did great. All knobs and buttons held up to rough handling. The buttons and knobs take some getting used to. It's a good idea to spend a day using it in its case to get familiar with how to actuate all the functions. Only three minor nits: the image quality (especially in sunny conditions) was noticeably lower than without the case. The flash doesn't work particularly well because the camera bulk shades it. It comes with a diffuser, but I was afraid it would fall off. Also, a more minor nit, I suppose, the microphone doesn't do well in the case when shooting video, but I can't see how they could improve on that. It ... does work, but you'll mostly hear the shooter's voice, not the subjects'. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I've had a Nikon P5200 since 2004. I love it still because it fits in my jeans front pocket so I carry it a lot and it takes great photos. I have been waiting until a worthy replacement came along that did everything as well as the P5200, fits neatly in my jeans pocket, an has manual controls. Nikon seems to be obsessed with low end point and shoots these days, so this loyal Nikon fan had to switch brands. The Canon S90 delivers. I've always thought that 5 Mpix was enough for a point shoot, especially as more pixels on a small sensor just adds more noise. But the S90 is not bad, and with manual controls and optical vibration reduction I find myself shooting at ASA 80 almost all the time with great results. That said, there are three things Canon missed out on. They should have give ... n this to a review panel before releasing it. (a) The wheel control on the back of the camera is too easy to spin, it needs to have a click mechanism like the lens ring control. This drives me nuts - sometimes I accidentally move the EV setting just as I take the photo. (b) My P5200 was faster when taking continuous photos. (c) No distortion correction for wide angle. Nikon does it on low end cameras - c'mon Canon - get off the grass! I almost returned the camera on account of these dissapointments, but hey, it's not a perfect camera world and I'm learning to live with the S90's touchy dial. And I wish it had a 'bulb' mode for the shutter, is that too hard to do? Four stars instead of five. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use mine as my carry-around camera. It lives in my briefcase. It has a wide variety of modes--from automatic point and shoot JPEGS to fully manual RAW images. Great RAW images up to ISO 400. The LCD is great for the size of the camera. I wished there was a greater zoom range on both ends.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: SLR features and flexibility
Cons: pop up flash. Ergonomics
I'm an amateur photographer and have been able to fulfill a large aprt of my photographic needs with an old 3.2 megapixel canon sd200. Although I'm planning to get an SLR to have the greatest number of possibilities, most of my good pictures have been taken in places and at times where an SLR would just be too cumbersome (cycling trip, skiing, rock climbing day, at a bar, etc...) The S90 off course is not an SLR, but it is a portable point and shoot that offers SLR-like features and greatly expands the scope of everyday photography. The image quality is great and I have always found Canon's software to be really intuituve and its logic has not changed since I got my SD 200 in 2003. So for whoever owns a canon, ... the software will be super easy to navigate through. The pop up flash is a problem that has been reported by many reviewers because it pops up exaclty where we're used to have our index finger. Otherwise, the camera could benefit from a small ridge/something to make more ergonomic and its hold more secure. It is a bit expensive as well. Overall a very good buy so far. Lets see if it lasts for a few years. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera offers the flexibility of a digital SLR with only a slight compromise in image quality. I have a Canon 5D and a Canon 20D and the images are very good from this camera, especially at higher ISO settings. The ring around the lens adds a level of convenience not found in most pocket cameras. The only cons I can find are the moderate zoom and in my opinion the shutter release button is in a poor location. Two small things considering the overall ability of this little pocket rocket.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: It is a good point and shoot with great optics but rather expensive. It is not a Leica in terms of picture quality. It is useful for scenic photography and not anything that is moving. Buy a Nikon D40, for less and have more flexibility. Hurry as they are discontinued. If pocket size is a must, similar quality can be had for half the cost, and from Canon. I have had 6 Canon point and shoots, starting with the G2, which I still love. My Leica LX 4 is great, takes a superb photo, but also expensive.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera is simply the best point and shoot camera ever. The images are stunning and the manual controls give you so many options that you can be as creative as you want. The control rings on the front and rear of the camera a very intuitive and easy to get a handle on. Setting exposure, ISO, even manual focus is a snap, and exploring the features is the easiest way to get started. For Novices and Pros alike, this camera will satisfy. Low light performance is alright, as expected with the size of the sensor, and Canon's processing is second to no ones in my opinion. The colors are vivid and pop. I have had many other powershots over the years, and still have my SD990, which I love, but this takes it to a whole new level, do not hesitate to buy it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The best compact camera so far
Item.Review:
Pros: Manual Controls, Image Quality, Size, Ergonomics
This little gem is performing so well in low light situations that everything else in the same price range just falls in the shade. Even at 400 ISO it performs way better than Panasonic LX3 and Leica D-Lux 4. At any number higher than 400 ISO it has no other compact competitor. It has good optics, good dynamic range, RAW capability, manual settings and a programmable ring which is very useful. You won't find another camera at this size, at this price with this image quality and all those features. A must have.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The Best Point & Shoot Hand Down
Item.Review: This is one serious little camera, I have owned numerous Canon Elphs over the years starting with the SD200 and more recently the SD990. The SD200 was a great little camera that recently died, but I have had the SD1000, SD870, recently purchased the SD780, which I love for the size and HD Video, and an SD990 with a underwater housing. I think Canon makes the best digital point and shoots and Nikon makes the best DSLR's. With that said, the S90 is in a class by itself. It combines the features of the G series cameras with the size of the Elph line. The manual controls are easy to use and the performance of this little gem is unbelievable. It is what it is, a superior point and shoot. So far I have really enjoyed using the exposure bracketing feature and have just scratched the surface, but ... I'm sure there will be a lot more to enjoy. As a Mac user, the only drawback is that there is no support for the Canon RAW format yet with Snow Leopard, so the S90 and G11 RAW files can only be read by Canon's proprietary software. I'm sure support will come on Apples next update. The camera has decent low light performance, but so does my SD990, like I said, it is what it is, not to be used for action shots or nighttime shooting, but, it does better than the previous generation of sensors with the DIGIC IV processor. What's not to like. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great image quality; Packed with features
I got this camera for Christmas last year and it was my favorite gift. The camera is very compact so I can take it everywhere I go without much of a hassle. There are many professional features built into this that are very useful for great pictures. Good aperture settings and the quality of my pictures are amazing. The buttons on the camera are really nicely spaced so it's more convenient for large hands. What I really like about this camera is that it feels really sturdy. It has a nice weight to it and the outer shell is a very solid plastic, not thin or light like other cameras. It's a good camera to use if you know how to adjust the settings because I find manual mode doesn't do my pictures justice most of the time, but t ... hat's just my opinion. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great photos in a small package.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great image quality; Easy to use; Packed with features; fast f/2 lenses; Full manual control
Cons: Slippery surface
For a pocketable camera, the S90 has nearly everything that I'm looking for.
One thing that's always frustrated me with compact point-and-shoot cameras is the lack of full manual controls and actually having the ability to control the shot how I want it. Too often I'm left to the mercy of the cameras and micro-chips deciding how my pictures should look instead of my natural creative talents. A camera's not really a camera unless if it unleashes your ability to somewhat have control and create your final shot. The S90 delivers on all those accounts. I'm able to pre-set focal lenghts, focus-zones, and on a whim, customize how my photo should look. ... Regarding images, except when shooting at higher-ISO's, the images are great up to ISO 400. If you're expecting images that have depth to them, like what you'll see from micro-four-thirds and larger sensors, you will end up dissapointed. For a camera it's size, though, it really delivers. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great image quality; Packed with features; Easy to use; fast f/2 lenses; Full manual control
Cons: screen scratches easiily
I have not buy a pocket point and shoot camera for a while, my previous one was a Canon s230 point and shoot from 2003.
Most of the time I shoot with my DSLR, the current one I have is a Nikon D80.
Canon s90 definitely performed well to shoot as a compliment for my Nikon DSLR, I know the theory and the logic behind photography, so I really don't need the fancy functions such as double LCD (front and back like some of the Samsungs) or some other fancy stuff. All I need is a pocketable camera that takes good pictures.
It really can get the job done! The picture quality is good enough, maybe not as good as my DSLR, but it's defini ... tely better than most of the point and shoot out there.
It has a F2.0 lens as well as a 28-105mm zoom, the big aperature just gives you so much more of light to work with in the low-light settings.
The manual operation is quite smooth and intuitive. In some occasion you want to shoot casually, this gives you focus more on the subject instead of thinking behind the viewfinder, toggling the function menu and try to figure out how are you going to shoot.
Overall, I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon S90- Best point and shoot camera out there
Item.Review:
Pros: Great image quality; Easy to use; Packed with features
Cons: Slippery surface; Loose Wheel
Im not an avid photographer or anything, but have owned over 5 cameras over the last 10 years. I generally purchase simple point and shoot cameras such as the SD110 and the SD 550, I can tell you that the S90 is by far and way the best point and shoot camera on the market. I did a ton of research prior to purchasing this camera. The low light picture taking is great as are all the available functions. The body is sleek, maybe a little too slippery, and the wheel on the back panel is a bit loose, but once you are used to it, youll see just how great this little camera is!
The S90 shares a lot of common components with the bigger G11. The G11 is also tauted as one of t ... he best cameras out there. The battery life seems good. I have gotten close to 200 pictures on one charge. I wish the video mode had an HD option but it does not. I believe the S95 has this option. Overall, this camera has made me extremely happy, allowing me to take great images of nature, rockets, skylines, and much more. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Incredible. I love this camera. I'm an avid (sometimes pro, mostly for fun) photographer. Until now, I've been a Nikon user, but this little camera has changed my mind completely. I'm now saving for a Canon t2i. What's great- takes crystal clear, beautiful shots. Fantastic low-light capacity. Dummy-proof for those with less photography experience. Takes great HD videos too! One small challenge is that the menu is a bit difficult to use and takes some times getting used to. Also, flash is typical of any small camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera blows away everything else I've seen in terms of soaking in all available light to produce realistic looking photos of inside shots. Seriously: tired of tossing pics because your subjects are dark? I was. Both WIRED magazine and NYTimes call this camera (and it's successor, the S95, if you want to pay another hundred bucks for the same basic thing) the very, very top. DSLR type pics for just over 300$??? Incredible. My family pics and outdoor landscapes, colors, and ESPECIALLY close ups look like National Geographic shots. In fact, I lost my first one and didn't think twice about buying a duplicate. Now, all my friends have one and family members, within a few months of showing S90 pictures to them. They can't believe it. Plus, AUTO function essentially does it all. ... Easiest camera I EVER USED. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: fast f/2 lenses; Great image quality; Packed with features
I needed a new camera before our vacation to Europe this year. Portability and photo quality were two of the most important things I was looking for. I was interested in stepping up to a better camera with more manual options because I am interested in taking more control with my photos. I think this camera is perfect for anyone looking to step up from the point and shoot world without moving all the way to a Digital SLR. This camera combines portable size with a high performance lens that opens all the way to F2.0. This enables great low light and indoor shots without having to use flash! It has a ton of shooting modes ranging from full manual to full auto mode, which makes it easy for a variety of people to pick up a ... nd use. A lot of people complain about it being "slippery", but I have had NO problems with this. It feels good in my hands and takes AMAZING pictures with the light it has available. You will not regret buying this camera! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The image quality of this camera is so excellent, it helps you forgive the slight shutter delay when taking pictures. It is fun to use and allows for a lot of manual control, which many other digital point and shoots do not. The flash works well and is powerful enough to light your subjects in a flattering way. Definitely get a second battery! It lasts for a while, but when it starts to fall off, it does so quickly.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have been very pleased with this camera in the three weeks I've had it. It can be easily set to function as a point-and-shoot, and it works admirably in that mode. However, it has so many capabilities that I am still learning them. The User Guide is well-written, but it could be considerably larger in size. I realize that the manufacturer wants to put out a guide that is easily portable, but, as one explores the many abilities of this beautifully-made camera, it would be very nice to have the directions in larger print. Packing all the details for a machine of this complexity into 178 4X6 pages is well-intentioned but silly. I'd like to be able to relax with the manual, rather than squint at it. Learning from the guide while in the field might be tough. Great camera, though.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this camera because I wanted a small camera to travel with (I pack light!). This camera is very nice and compact, but retains the capability to modify camera settings. I took it on a trip to Germany, and I'm thrilled with the pictures I got. I was concerned about not having a viewfinder, but that was not a problem at all. The screen is bright enough to see the image even in sunlit conditions.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: S90 a great replacement for our SD870
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Good Image Stabilization; Small / Compact; Good in Low Light; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay
This camera was chosen to replace our SD870 which suffered a lens failure after many years of use. It is primarily used when carrying a larger D-SLR is difficult. So mostly we use it for travel, mostly motorcycle travel where size and weight are critical. It has met our needs so far. It's already been used on a motorcycle trip to Yellowstone with good results. The S90 is easy to use. It works well in full auto mode but provides the option of manual override of many things if desired. I particularly like ISO 80 with its crisp detail. Shutter and Aperature priority are available if needed. The front control ring is a nice feature a ... nd makes the camera feel more professional. The only negative in my mind is the lag time for action sequences. The lag is mostly noticeable when coming from a digital SLR. All-in-all a great choice as a small, compact camera with a host of features for most uses. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great camera. Love the manual mode. Images turned out awsome. I am impressed by the performance under a low light condition and the night shots were beautiful. Very user friendly too. Unfortunately, it does not have HD video and the battery life is not long. It's recommanded to get an extra battery for travel.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I wanted a RAW-shooting compact point and shoot with solid glass and sensor, and this delivers fully on all counts. Program mode with the ability to adjust exposure on the fly got me fantastic shots in a shoot-from-the-hip mode, contrast looks great, and the function wheel around the lens is a surprisingly nice touch. My one complaint is battery life. I used the bulk of three batteries over the course of a week/about 300 shots. If I can find a longer-lived aftermarket battery pack, I'll be completely ecstatic with this purchase. Overall great.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
This camera is small enough to fit in a pocket or small fanny pack. The pictures are really sharp. For its size and price, it is a great camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I love this camera housing! It worked great for my needs. I went to Hawaii last week and toted it around with me to every beach we went to. My photos came out a lot clearer than they would've if i used a disposable camera. The photo clarity underwater usually depended on the clarity of the water - Hawaii has beautiful 'blue' water which was pretty clear most of the time. I found it easy to use the camera's features (zoom, flash, etc) and navigate through the different menus even when I was in the middle of snorkeling. Make sure to read the user manual prior to using the camera housing. It contains important instructions on how to prepare your housing before use and how to care for it when you aren't using it. Gotta protect your investment that's protecting your investment rig ... ht? Don't think about it any more S90 owners...just buy it already! You'll love it too :-) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Small and powerful. Great in low light!
Item.Review: Very small, very well built. Powerful with tons of features. The low light support is the best I've seen on a digital camera. Can hand hold lots of shots without a flash you would normally need a flash/tripod for.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The ring function makes this camera special and gives you more control. You can choose what you want the ring to do-I like to have it adjust the f/stop and the shutter. The pictures are clear and crisp-great photo quality. The camera is a little slower, but that is after being used to using a DSLR. I have a hard time focusing when I try to take macro photo.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am a busy mother of 2 boys 8 months and 23 months. I use this camera for all our family pictures. We had a Cannon elph and had to replace it. So far, this one appears to take better pictures and the auto mode helps you focus on the faces in the picture. We are hoping to take great family pics at the beach. The size is wonderful to carry everywhere!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Perfect for travel. Excellent canon interface, like an SLR. Perfect to learn photography basics w/o spent much money in an SLR It doesn't fit in your pocket, even it's small.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: pictures look great
Cons: flash and controls
this canon is a little more expensive than most point and shoot. I have a rebel xti and old canon a85. I am replacing the a85 with this one. I like point and shoots to bring to places where I don't want to carry my dslr. well, this camera takes pics as well as my rebel. Don't like the flash popping up. Wish they had mounted on front. My finger is always in the way. The controls are a little getting used to with control ring and back ring. I accidentally keep changing things. I am sure once I get the hang of it, it will be a snap. Really love how the pics come out though. Battery life doesn't seem to be that great. After charging the 1st time, it seemed it ran down kind of quick.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: I am very happy that I chose the s90!
Item.Review: I think it is great! It is small, portable, takes fabulous pictures and is customizable. If you can't already tell, I am not a professional or especially adept. I am learning and I think this a great camera to do that on- you can manipulate the settings or work within their many presets/auto function. The only draw back is the moving ring on the back- it is very sensitve and I have definitley switched modes by accident a few times. It aso does have a bit of trouble focusing sometimes- I'm still working out all the kinks. Overall, I'm very happy that I have it- the pictures are gorgeous so far!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Short Lag Time; Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization
This is a very good camera. Easy to handle, Point and shoot. Image results are very good. can be compared to SLR's output.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best underwater Case I have ever Used
Item.Review: [...]This case screams quality,everything about it is made to last, i have not tested it out in much deeper than 5-7 meters of water. Takes an already top of the line camera and makes it more versatile. Picture quality is fantastic. all the buttons are clearly marked on the case itself,great price, great product. protects the camera at the same time as adding another element to this camera already large list of features.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: A great product for semipro users
Item.Review: This is a great camera if you like the small size and weight of a compact digital camera but dont want to lose the manual capabilities of a DSLR camera. The two-ring function (one in the lens and the other in the back) is great when you get accostumed to it. The one thing i dont like is that is a little slow in how much photographs per second you can take, compared to other cameras.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This highly rated compact digital camera does not disappoint. I love having access to every element of exposure. Even in auto mode, I noticed that the camera correctly set itself to macro mode for closeups, and also correctly chose a flash fill mode for indoor photographs which allowed for more of the background to be seen. Having all of this creative control in such a small package makes it a joy to carry around. The best feature: a 28mm F2 lens for low light situations.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good image quality, not for large hands
Item.Review: Originally bought this to supplement my Canon 1DMKIII as a pocketable alternative. Nice build quality, I like the front control ring, and the image quality. It is compact and if you have large hands, you may find it too small. After using a DSLR for so many years, it was also hard to get used to not having a view finder. If you're looking for a high end, compact, point and shoot it's hard to beat the S90. My problem was that it was too small. It was hard to hold with confidence that I wouldn't fumble it. If you're used to small cameras, you'll love it. For now, I'll stick with the Canon Rebel when I need something smaller.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good and Plenty, Full Featured Compact
Item.Review: If you are looking for a compact camera with plenty of manual features, this is the camera to look at. I am a professional photographer, and wanted a small compact to use when it is not convenient to bring my SLR. I took time to search the internet, and this was at the top of the list. Amazing sharp photos, in any lighting conditions, with intuitive aperture/shutter priority settings with a rotating ring on the front base of the camera lens. You will love this camera especially at entertainment events and shows where they do not allow flash photography. Cameras with only scene settings can not measure up to this power packed camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I took this baby on vacation and it did exactly what I needed. It is easy to carry, easy to use, the images are crisp & clear. Downloading to my computer is fast and simple. The only problem I encountered was when the flash decides to pop up and the index finger of my left hand is there holding the camera. I am now aware of the situation so I am retraining my left hand's position. That is a trade-off when you go from a full size SLR to a compact Point & Shoot. Aside from that, the camera is impressive and well worth the purchase!!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Was originally wanting an SLR camera and yes, this camera does not compare to an SLR but...if you are in the market for a point and shoot this camera rocks! The price was right the options were right and the camera takes VERY nice pictures! Would easily buy this camera again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Compactness fits very nicely into watertight case. Love ISO 80-6400, f2.0 lens speed, and ability to take Raw is great. Wonderful quality and functionality for the price. Enough quality to take Professional looking photos..in those extreme conditions one does not want to risk your expensive gear in.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I purchased the S-90 and left immediately for the Tetons and Yellowstone, leaving behind my larger camera. I came home with great pictures. I found the camera easy to use and enjoyed the fact that it allows manual settings of aperture, shutter speed and focus. Or I could be lazy and shoot in automatic mode. Only one small complaint: the back adjustment ring moves too easily and I had to continually monitor my hand position so I wouldn't change settings. Overall this is a very good small pocket camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The pictures will hardly tell you how small this camera really is: it fits into a shirt pocket and other small compartments. This camera can be a steady companion for the pixel quality-oriented shooter. This camera is well-suited for those who want to leave their DSLR at home at times, but still like to have RAW pixel-editing capability. The zoom range is excellent, as are overall build and picture quality. It is hard to perceive that one can fit more real camera into a smaller case. Recommended for all pro/semipro-DSLR owners with need for an on-the-go camera solution.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is a great camera when you can't take your DSLR with you. Very low noise level for a point and shoot. Do not expect DSLR noise level though. I find ISO 800 definitely usable. ISO 1600 usable for smaller prints. Many people complain about ergonomics. I don't find it to be a problem if you don't have large hands, but it may take some time to figure out how to hold the camera. Once you learn the camera, pretty much any setting you are likely to change a lot is 1 or 2 seconds away.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera when I don't want to carry my Canon DSLR. It's my first light and small camera. The pictures are sharp. The directions are clear. I haven't used it in low light. I am used to having large areas for holding a camera. I still push buttons or turn the wheel without meaning to. I think I will get used to that.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Limited Zoom
I just got my S90 as a replacement for my broken Canon SD550. I tried the Casio Exilim series the day before, and I returned it right the way. I'm impressed by the S90's performance: sharp images and low light performance for its class. The auto mode is so smart you rarely need to switch to manual mode, which is something fun because it works like a regular SLR in petite size. I would say the S90's image quality is very close to an entry level DSLR w/o the size and weight.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Powershot S90 Made Me Feel Like A Pro!
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Short Lag Time
I decided to purchase it and use it on my vacation in DC,, NYC, Buffalo, and Niagara Falls. I chose the Canon Powershot S90 because I wanted the ease of a point and shoot and I wanted to be able to use it in my photography classes. It worked great in museums taking clear no flash pictures of art and artifacts in low light. The zoom was great for smaller objects d'art as well as far away things like Niagara Falls. I couldn't believe how much detail there was with the great close-ups. Even pictures of scenery and famous sites taken on the top of tour buses and boats as well as in the AMTRAK train were clear. I took hundreds of pictures. I especially liked the ability to link pictures a ... nd the short lag time unlike my much older Sony which I still love to use for videos. I looked forward to using the manual features after my vacation when I could sit down and work my way through the manual, but my camera was stolen at the Smithsonian Castle on the last day of my vacation. Not sure what to do now. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This camera is perfect for being spontaneous. It's lightweight, small size and discreet. it has good controls for people who like to be more creative and think about what they're shooting. The quality of the pics is amazing for the size of the chip. All round a great camera as a stand alone do anything point and shoot or a perfect compliment to your DSLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: PowerShot S90 is very close to DSLR
Item.Review: I am very pleased with my S90! It comes very close to my Canon XTi DSLR in many ways. I did a lot of research before buying it, & I'm glad I bought it. The color is very crisp & true. The size is just right ... not too big/not too small. I don't find the pop up flash a deal breaker at all. The easily moveable wheel on the back requires some watching, but it's not insurmountable either. The zoom range and the 2.0 lens are the reasons I bought the camera. I took photos on a swaying boat last weekend & even though my hand & the boat were moving, the photos came out very crisp & not at all blurry. They matched almost what I could get with my XTi.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best low light camera I've ever used.
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization
The 2.0 lens allows indoor photos with available light without a problem. Other than that feature it's quite similar to cameras for 1/3 to 1/2 the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Lens and program/manual control
Cons: needs better grip for left hand
I bought the SX210, found indoor shots of poor quality, returned it and ordered the S90. The S90 is about what I was looking for in a high end point and shoot. The lens is great, pretty fast indoor and out. The 10 MP is more than enough. It has plenty of program modes and still gives you manual control.
The only down side for me so far, is flash real easy to cover and lack of grip for left hand. I will probably order after market grip. I have not had a problem with the control dial that I know of. The S90 does not have a massive zoom lens but that's why we have slrs!
In closing, for the extra $18.00+/_ over the price of the SX210, I think I got over $100.00 more in value! I would have ra ... ted 5 stars had the grip been better. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Sharp pictures, ease of use
Cons: No HD video
Owned the camera for a week and tested it by taking various shots during the day and night. The picture quality is amazingly sharp and using the camera is remarkably easy considering all the stuff that is in it. If you are lazy, the AUTO actually does a darn good job alone.
For night shots, it performed generally pretty good. Though don't expect it to perform at a quality level like a DSLR, I still had to have a steady hand for non-flash shots and it does recommend using a tripod for such shots. But if its a well lite outdoors area, you should be fine.
Overall I feel this was an excellent purchase, even if it is at the high-end of point and shoot cameras. Only issue I see is the the movie recorded doesn't do HD ... , but that's not why I purchased it anyway. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Small and compact compared to my S80
Item.Review: I replaced our S80 with this and was impressed with the quality of photos from a much smaller camera. My only hesitation in buying this was the lack of an optical viewfinder. After all, I am a professional photographer and for 40 years, I have been looking for viewfinders. I think for a point-and-shoot, this works good. For action, it might be difficult to move with the subject. For a more pro camera, I want to focus through an optical viewfinder. The image quality and AE ability is very good. No HD video is a negative.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought the camera to meet the requirements of a beginners' digital photography class. It offers much more opportunity for individual control of settings than the (good) point-&-shoot I have enjoyed for 2 years. Happily, the instructions in the Camera Guide and on the screen seem, so far, clear and easy to follow. so far, however, I am finding it a bit awkward to hold and I am not sure why. I am hoping this will resolve with repeated use.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice and small with excellent pictures
Item.Review:
Pros: Brillant display; Possiblity of RAW; Good in Low Light; Good wide angle f20; Very Compact
Cons: Setting somet confusing; Slow
A good addition for the DSLR-equipment: small, compact, with a good RAW-picture quality. Also ideal for night shots (only a small tripod necessary) with 15 sec exposure time. 28mm wide angle with f2,0 cannot be beaten by most APS-C - sensor DSLR's - so ideal for evening shots. On the other side: slow focusing compared to a DSLR, sometimes diffuculty function settings. But: I don't know an overall better small camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Good Image Stabilization; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color
Cons: Small for large hands
This little camera can do almost everything. The pictures I've taken on the Auto setting even turned out wonderful. Does very well in low light conditions. The camera is small so it's difficult to hold onto at times (fixed this with an aftermarket grip). The dial on the back can be turned very easily so it takes practice to not jostle it while I'm taking pictures. Fits into my pocket so it goes with me everywhere. So far, I am very satisfied with this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color
The Canon S90 is an excellent pocketable camera I use when I can't carry my SLR with me. It has almost all of the adjustments I look for and they are so convenient to use through the two programmable dials. So easy to use, so small and such great pictures!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: lanscapes, people, low light, bright sun, beach, city, concert, poolside, video, drive-by-photos. all surpassing expectations. small and powerful not to into the bundled carrying case; the camera wrist holder tends to get caught in the zippers.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I've bought the case for underwater photography. I haven't used this specific one, but I've used the case for Canon G10, which is more or less the same. Operating it under water is very easy, because the main buttons are located in reachable places. If you're trying to change some cmoplex functions set under the water - it's possible, but not too easy. Regarding depth - it's rated to 40 meters, which is more than the limit for NDL (regular SCUBA) dive. If you're planning to go Trimixing or on deeper dive, don't take it there or take it down to 40m and tie it there until (and if..) you're coming back. The nice thing about this case is that it can be used out of the water in places you're afraid to use your camera in - beach for example, due to the sand. The disadvantage is that you take a p ... retty small and handy camera like the S90, and you put it in a case that is quite big. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Good in Low Light
Cons: Short Battery Life
This is a great point and shoot. The only thing is, its almost to small. Though that is one of the reasons I picked it out. I am a semi-pro, that wanted to have a carry around every where that shot in RAW. This does it all, perfect for what I wanted it for, the only con it has, is the battery life SUCKS, Buy a couple of after market batteries to throw in your bag, your going to need them.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Short Battery Life
I like this camera very much. It's light weight and easy to use. I can carry it with me all the time and take the photos whenever I want and it has a good image quality, very clean and many choices to get a better picture. The only problem is that the picture seems a little yellow at night in door. I will purchase a DSRL camera later I think this one is a good choice before I have a DSRL one. I also bought another battery in case its short battery life. However, it can take about 200 photos with a fully charged battery. Usually that's enough for me.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: As an alternative to carrying a bulky DSLR this pocket sized gem rocks for high quality low light shots. The lens is the best I have seen on a point n shoot camera and it is almost as versitile as one of the big DSLR cousins.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality of Picture, Speed of processing and Different Preset Modes.
Cons: Expensive, Little heavy.
I had a SONY DSC W180 before purchasing S90. The primary reason for switching the camera is the quality of picture and speed of processing. I would say this is one of the best camera for a person to know about photography. The quality of picture generated is really cool. I really liked the feature to generate the panoramic pictures (using software). Different presets provided in the camera are good for anybody who wants to learn to take good pictures. The camera also provides a way to adjust the aperture manually.
The camera provides a way to navigate the pictures through rolling button on top of the button click.
Overall I would say this is one great camera ... and I am very satisfied with this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The S90 is a small camera with big features. It is very user friendly and allows the user flexibiilty. Its small in size to take anywhere with similar features and quality of a SLR. Its the right balance between point and shoot and SLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: When I do not want to carry 4 pounds of DSLR around this is my camera. Image quality is very good but not large sensor quality. I have printed some images at 11x 14 and have been satisfied. It is a fun camera to use. There are some chromatic aberrations, the rear control dial is too easy to turn and battery life is not the best. Even with these few flaws I would purchase again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: as many other people, I bought it based on the review from[@] I wanted a small portable camera with good quality. it was small, quality was good. I just couldn't stand the menus, and the lens, altough fast, seemed somehow not up to my expectations. ie, at manual mode, lens would go down to f4, but not higher than f9 if I am right. I was expecting full control from f4 to, say, f22. also, the lag time was just killing me. I returned it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best compact camera made, hands down
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality is top notch, low level light pictures possible without flash (low aperture), compact-take it everywhere
Cons: Back screen has a glare protectant coat that can show "scratches" very easily. Use a screen protector.
I have $4000 in professional SLR camera equipment and this camera takes pictures almost as good as the expensive stuff. It has limits that other camera doesn't have, but most of the pictures taken are equal in quality. Just beautiful pictures. Everyone who sees them is amazed.
I added Richard Franiec's custom grip to the front of it. Great addition to the camera. Makes it more easily operated with just one hand. And it keeps it safer and in my hand (not slipping out as easily). Just Google his name to find the grip. Great product. I am n ... ot affiliated, just love the product.
I also added a Lexerd screen protector to save the protective glare coating on the screen that "scratches" very easily. It isn't a true scratch in the screen (glass), but it takes on that appearance when that protective coating starts to get marred. I've read other people just used a solvent to remove the coating. Either way the screen is beautiful and shows a great representation of your picture.
I also love the ease of the jog dial to scroll through the pictures. They transition by rolling across the screen. Pretty cool little effect that can be changed.
People have commented that the flash is in a "bad" place as it pops up right under where your left pointer finger usually would sit while taking a picture with two hands. I'm not sure where else they would put the flash. And most people don't know this but the further the flash is away from the lens, the better your picture will come out (less red-eye too). So if it was embedded in the camera and didn't pop up, you get less quality pictures. Be happy it pops up. And because of the super low aperture (f/2.0) this camera can take pictures at, you'll be surprised how infrequently the flash actually does try to pop up and fire. Most of the pics I take, even indoors at night, do not require the flash. Note - lower aperture means more light is being let in. And light is EVERYTHING in photography.
I really think this is the best compact Digital c ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Build; High ISO; Accurate White Balance; Good Image Stabilization; Metal Body; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color; Short Lag Time; F20
Cons: Short Battery Life
This camera is good for both "camera dummy" and "camera enthusiast". The auto mode takes cares of almost all of the business for "camera dummies", the M, TV, AV modes are good for "camera enthusiasts". It is small, and full of powerful functions. If you ever consider this camera, it means you are serious about the photo quality. You either go for S90 or DSLR, G11 is not an option because it is too heavy and too big to be a DC, and not powerful enough to be a DSLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Limited Zoom; Short Battery Life
Great Camera! Easy to use. Very flexible. Great images. Love it.Would buy it again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: My first digital camera. Good pictures in low light, up to 800ISO. Good and bright lenses. Fit's in a pocket and the aperture ring is very fun. The battery is a bit short. Three days, 300 photos, barelly no flash and a recharge is needed. Overal a very nice camera!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I can perfectly understand why some people are complaining about this camera. If you compare the quality of pictures produced by this camera with a cheaper (but still decent) P&S, you will not see a lot of difference. Some cheaper cameras have greater zoom range and more traditional ergonomics (no pop-up flash, no freely moving dials, the shutter release button in a common place, etc.). If you are simply looking for a better camera to take family photos, don't buy this one, it was not specifically made for this purpose. This is a photographer's camera and its strength is the ability to fully control the picture taking process. If you only shoot in full auto mode, you will get the same quality pictures as many other P&S cameras that cost significantly less. Photographers know exactl ... y why they are buying this little marvel. In fact, many of them have been waiting for a camera like that for years. As an amateur photographer, I can tell you this: I would still buy this camera even if it had no zoom at all (in fact, I'd prefer it). Ergonomics could've been a bit better though. All in all -- great photographer's camera (but they know it already). It may not be the best choice for everybody else, especially considering the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this camera again
Item.Review: I have had this camera for three weeks and carried it to DC with me last week. Great camera, fairly easy to use and even on auto or scene settings takes very good pictures while offering almost SLR creativity in a pocket size camera. RAW image capture is a plus. Very good in low light settings including indoors. Wish the camera had a bit more zoom range and battery life might be a problem but other than that its 5 stars.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this camera to take pictures at gigs where I'm not allowed with my DSLR. With the 2.0 aperture and quality of the photos at ISO 800 it's perfect. The only bad thing is that it has no viewfinder and LCD will drain the battery.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The fast lens, the effective auto ISO and the control ring and dial make this camera so easy for taking full control of creative photography...all in a pocket size camera. The addition of the low light feature, programmable button and great menus complete its versatility and ease of use. Everything I have always wanted in a pocket sized camera. The quality of the images is fantastic. Even at >800 ISO the quality is still very good with little noise. The low light feature where it pushes the ISO to the extreme and reduces the noise by reducing the number of image pixels is brilliant.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I indicate this camera to all photographers who want to have control over their pocket cameras. Nice slow mode with flash, f/stop 8.0 gives sharp images, easy to use controls at manual mode. The only problem is with high ISO. ISO is ok until 400. At 800 or higher better use jpeg mode, RAW images get a lot of noise which is difficult to reduce. Picture quality is good. But the big pro is that you have a very thin and compact camera which allows you to control everything manually. Congratulations to Canon. Finally someone made a digital compact cameras for photographers. I would compare this camera to the famous leica minilux. I think it will change the future of compact cameras.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Point and shoot at wide end.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact
Cons: Bad telezoom end F49; Poor Image Quality
When i'm on a trip and don't feel like dragging my gears around. This fits nicely into my jeans pocket. The only thing i hate about it is the colour reproduction... i wish canon won't smoothen out the picture and turn skin tone pale as much as they are doing now... else this would almost be the perfect P&S.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Fantastic photos from a small camera
Cons: NA
I was actually looking to purchase a new D-SLR when my Olympus point and shoot stopped working. I had read about the S90 a little while back and it sounded quite promising, After further research I decided it would be the perfect camera to replace my p&s (sadly, my new D-SLR would have to wait).
So far I've had the camera for about a month and it's been an absolute joy to use. The controls are easy enough to use and the ring is a great idea, it feels like a SLR although smaller. The photo quality is amazing for something that can fit in your pocket, I always have a camera with me and this is the best one to have because of its size.
There are other great features like stitch assist and smile recognition, et ... c. but those can be found on other cameras. The reason anyone should by this camera over another is because of its size and picture quality. This camera is far superior to any camera in its class and is worth every penny. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I heard good things about this camera from posts like these and from sites like kenrockwell. I bought it because of the fast 2.0 lens. I have mixed feelings about this camera. The flash is in the wrong place. Who holds the camera with only the right hand? The shutter button is also in the wrong place. Two circular areas are at the top edge of the camera. The spot where the shutter button is supposed to be is where the options button is. I press and no picture is taken, then I have to slide my finger to the left to find the actual button. I am sure I would get used to this horrible ergonomic failing, but I usually use my DSLR and this camera is my 'always be available' camera.The image quality is not a quantum jump up from my older P&S Canon. For [$], the S90 is pricey. The other surpri ... se is the picture on the camera's LCD looks much better then how the picture appears on my computers.I am still undecided about returning the camera or not to return it. I am leaning to returning it since my older Canon is a 3X optical zoom, and I plan on buying the new Canon SX210 IS with its greater 14x zoom. Yes, I will lose the fast lense, but I will get the longer 14x zoom.Overall, it really did not live up to the hype for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S90 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Perfect Canon Point and Shoot Camera
Item.Review: Pros: Easy To Use, Excellent picture quality, Excels In Low Light, Fast f2 Lens, Good Image Stabilization, Large Clear LCD, Small / Compact ... Cons: No Flash Hotshoe, No Molded Grip On Camera, No Viewfinder, Short Battery Life It's almost like having a mini DSLR in your pocket. Excellent full controls for those that like to shoot in manual, aperture, and shutter priority modes. I highly recommend adding a 3rd party grip that will improve the ergonomics of the camera. Just do a Google search for "Nikon S90 grip" and you'll find links to it. Having a second battery is a must when on extended outings. This camera also makes a great backup if you travel with your DSLR.
